</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="a54e3c8e4571f5bf7daf2f792e4f1997ea2c0e607fc8f2f88d64eb6a9fda091869" />
<EnumerationListItem name="IK_UnsetInit">

</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="a54e3c8e4571f5bf7daf2f792e4f1997ea7ebc73b9a8ae7021a66c708ce5fc5a2a" />
<EnumerationListItem name="IK_ArgumentInit">

</EnumerationListItem>

</EnumerationList>

This enum is laid out by a preorder traversal of the inheritance hierarchy, and does not contain an entry for abstract classes, as per the recommendation in docs/HowToSetUpLLVMStyleRTTI.rst.

We also explicitly include &quot;first&quot; and &quot;last&quot; values for each interior node of the inheritance tree, to make it easier to read the corresponding classof().

We could pack these a bit tighter by not having the IK&#95;FirstXXXInit and IK&#95;LastXXXInit be their own values, but that would degrade readability for really no benefit.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/tablegen/record-h/#l00300">300</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/tablegen/record-h">Record.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>

<SectionDefinition>

## Public Member Functions

### convertInitializerBitRange() {#a0b6a1d8d53a93c7d333d3e6f4a664a12}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>virtual const Init &#42; llvm::Init::convertInitializerBitRange (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; unsigned &gt; Bits) const</>}
  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
This function is used to implement the bit range selection operator.

Given a value, it selects the specified bits, returning them as a new <code><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/init">Init</a></code> of type <code>bits</code>. If it is not legal to use the bit selection operator on this value, null is returned.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/tablegen/record-h/#l00389">389</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/tablegen/record-h">Record.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### convertInitializerTo() {#ab33fcbf534985fedfc7a1795aa54175b}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>virtual const Init &#42; llvm::Init::convertInitializerTo (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/recty">RecTy</a> &#42; Ty) const</>}>
Convert to a value whose type is <code>Ty</code>, or return null if this is not possible.

This can happen if the value&#39;s type is convertible to <code>Ty</code>, but there are unresolved references.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/tablegen/record-h/#l00382">382</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/tablegen/record-h">Record.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

Unset values are concrete.

### resolveReferences() {#a00581957c4bb1587a458c3fbf4326f7a}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>virtual const Init &#42; llvm::Init::resolveReferences (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/resolver">Resolver</a> &amp; R) const</>}
  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
This function is used by classes that refer to other variables which may not be defined at the time the expression is formed.

If a value is set for the variable later, this method will be called on users of the value to allow the value to propagate out.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/tablegen/record-h/#l00404">404</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/tablegen/record-h">Record.h</a>.
